column1:
Micro-Activities:
1) List of activites that are typically half-an-hour to two hours in duration; include relevant facts & details.
2) Ensure that you make a log entry at least every two hours.
3)  If a task takes many hours, break up the activies into multiple log entries. Each log entry should describe your accomplishments for time blocks of approximately two hours.

column5: Activity Log for First Design Project 1.0 (organisation & template reports)

column7: description of Micro-Activity ( include relevant facts and details)

DP1.0 review: Looked over the DP1.0 report outline and checked whether all required sections are present (intro, baseline, candidates, conclusion). Cross-examined the planned comparison approach (speed vs cost) against a couple online references to confirm what metrics are normally reported (timing/Fmax + resource utilization).

Online cross-check: Used YouTube and Google Scholar to sanity-check carry-save vs ripple adder tradeoffs (area vs speed) and how FPGA results are typically presented. Wrote brief bullet notes for what screenshots/tables should support the final write-up (RTL/Technology Viewer + timing/resource summaries).

Wrap-up: Re-read the outline to ensure the planned evidence and comparisons are consistent. Consolidated research notes into a short checklist of items to verify later during implementation/testing (metrics, figures, and citations).
Collected data to create a table for Analysis of Cost
Created a summary of the analysis to add to the reports
Wrote the summary report, went over it with group mates for feedback
Went over the main report by giving feedback on report and making some small changes
